questions.statement: Which of these operators is used to allocate memory to array variable in Java?
questions.explain: Operator new allocates block of memory specified by the size of array, and gives the reference of memory allocated to the array variable.

questions.statement: Which of these is an incorrect array declaration?
questions.explain: Operator new must be succeeded by array type and array size.

options: Class address hashcode in hexadecimal form
correctAns: Class address hashcode in hexadecimal form
questions.explain: If we trying to print any reference variable internally, toString() will be called which is implemented to return the String in following form: Address in hexadecimal form

questions.statement: Which of these is an incorrect Statement?
options: It is necessary to use new operator to initialize an array.
Array can be initialized using comma separated expressions surrounded by curly braces.
Array can be initialized when they are declared.
correctAns: It is necessary to use new operator to initialize an array.
questions.explain: Array can be initialized using both new and comma separated expressions surrounded by curly braces example : int arr[5] = new int[5]; and int arr[] = { 0, 1, 2, 3, 4};

questions.statement: Which of these is necessary to specify at time of array initialization?
What is the output of this program?
questions.explain: When an array is declared using new operator then all of its elements are initialized to 0 automatically. for loop body is executed 5 times as whenever controls comes in the loop i value is incremented twice, first by i++ in body of loop then by ++i in increment condition of for loop.

questions.statement: What is the output of this program?
questions.explain: arr[][] is a 2D array, array has been allotted memory in parts. 1st row contains 1 element, 2nd row contains 2 elements and 3rd row contains 3 elements. each element of array is given i + j value in loop. sum contains addition of all the elements of the array.

questions.explain: Array arr contains 10 elements. n contains 6 thus in next line n is given value 2 printing arr[2]/2 i:e 2/2 = 1.
